DOC.brief_summary: The aim study evaluate effect Ginkgo Biloba Extract ( GBE ) executive function-impaired Mild Cognitive Impairment ( MCI ) patient assess gait walk alone well differ dual-task condition . The primary endpoint evaluation GBE efficacy gait speed . The secondary endpoint cycle time variability dual-task condition .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Ginkgo Biloba Special Extract LI 1370 Dual-tasking Patients With MCI
DOC.criteria: Age 5085 year Swiss German German speaker Completed elementary school Impaired executive function ( gait speed reduction â‰¥ 10 % dualtask compare normal walk ) No dementia accord International Classifications Diseases ( ICD ) 10 Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders ( DSM ) IV . Cognitive decline ( self/informant report objective task ) Preserved basic activity daily live minimal impairment complex instrumental function Written inform consent nihil obstat Current drug treatment Warfarinlike drug ( Coumarins Clopidogrel ) , however , acetylsalicylic acid 100mg 300mg permit Current intake GBE last 6 month Known hypersensitivity GBE constituent Regular intake antipsychotic , anxiolytic sedative drug ( allow clinically stable least past 3 month treatment ) Concomitant gaitrelevant disorder : severe cardio/pulmonary/cerebron vascular disorder , bleed diathesis , polyneuropathy severe orthopedic disorder , organic cerebral disease epilepsy , low vision Severe medical condition ( e.g . chronic renal insufficiency , severe hepatic disorder , cardiovascular disease , uncontrolled hypertension , peptic ulcer , malignoma ) Participation another clinical intervention study within last 2 month Use walk aid Normal walk speed < 100cm/s
DOC.keyword: Gait , Ginkgo biloba , mild cognitive impairment
